item.title: Report X-2025010609
item.description:
Report X-2025010609

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH location a fiberboard box with signs of a release was found. The fiberboard box contained four one gallon plastic bottles and the cap came off one and spilled it's contents. The shipmnet was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025010568
item.description:
Report X-2025010568

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-22
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1488000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Train 6K4B323 derailed 8 cars at milepost CP 500. The derailment involved tank car NATX301714. The derailment caused the BOV nipple to be sheared off. The BOV remained closed but product bypassed the valve. The valve opening was plugged to stop the leak.

item.title: Report E-2025010082
item.description:
Report E-2025010082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 19:35 EST on 12/12, Dan with XPO-XSB contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 10 gallons of "ACTIVATOR" from 2x 5gal metal pails impacting the trailer and dock floors. The pails were punctured by a forklift at XSB. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor assist with additional PPE, citing goggles. Placed the (2) 5-gallon pails in 55-gallon metal drum and staged for terminal management to handle.
